metadata.name: Potential Adplus.EXE Abuse
metadata.comment: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\adplus.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('adplus.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -hang ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -pn ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -pmn ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -p ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -po ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -sc '))))

output.summary: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate usage of Adplus for debugging purposes References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/OtherMSBinaries/Adplus/, https://twitter.com/nas_bench/status/1534916659676422152, https://twitter.com/nas_bench/status/1534915321856917506
